children.subject: I believe whenever they state 61B as a requirement, 61BL satisfies that requirement.
How will prereq enforcement be done when I will be taking Cs 61BL over the summer to satisfy the requirement?
Please contact the professor for the class. I never heard back regarding how he wanted to set the class up for enrollment so I carried forward settings from a prior year.

Is there a reason why there is no waitlist for CS160? There's 50 seats on classes.berkeley.edu but 120 Seats on Calcentral, but when I try to enroll there are 0 seats on the waitlist. I'm an intended CS major.
according to @11804 it's not this semester
Yep, just saw that. Very disappointing esp with its awful time slot :/
It's up to each faculty member to determine how they want to teach their class and whether they will allow time conflicts. Prof Kubiatowicz has opted to not allow time conflicts in F20.

"Hello.  We are not allowing conflicting classes (and will likely have some attendance requirement)."

- The response I got when I emailed Professor Kubiatowicz.
Is there a particular reason time conflicts are not allowed for CS 162? I was under the impression it's usually webcast
Unfortunately the professor who had been assigned to teach the class in F20 (Tygar) passed away so the class has to be re-assigned & that hasn't been resolved yet.
Also Professor Sinclair will be on sabbatical
Is there any specific reason for the issue with CS70? I thought it was pretty standard for Professors Sinclair and Song to teach in Fall semesters.
I have taken CS 88, Data 8 and CS 61B. Wondering if that can be accepted?

You should contact the professors for the class with these questions. The system will not allow for substitutes without instructor evaluation/consent. (In other words, you will need to get a permission code from the instructor to enroll.)
Got it -- thank you!
I haven't taken 61A, but I have taken E7, 61B, and 70; will this be able to count re: 169A's prereqs?

I've heard rumors that it's being considered but I have no information about if/when that might happen. Obviously there are many constraints and unknowns for F20 right now that impact all department decisions. But we hear you!

It would be great if CS 182 can offered and also at greater capacity. Most of the students in spring 2020 semester had to pnp their grades due to huge uncertainties and stress. 182 is considered to be direct continuation of 189 and I hope students like us can benefit from taking this class in the fall semester as an "alternative" to override PNPs on 189. Thanks and much appreciated.
You can always look up the class @ Berkeleytime.com to see what happened in past semesters.
What are my chances of getting into 61B as an Engineering Science student with 3 terms of attendance?

If you do not meet the requirement group criteria then you will be placed on the wait list until the adjustment period begins. At that time the reserve capacities come down and any open seats are released to the wait list that then processes in sequential order.
That makes sense. Thank you Cindy!
It appears that for enrollment in CS61C, both the lab and discussion 999 section are putting me to waitlist despite having open seats. Is there some sort of manual approval procedure?

It SHOULD allow you to enroll with CS 61BL as pre-req. I've asked Registrar to confirm the pre-req settings.

Please try again tomorrow & if it doesn't work, then email cs-enrollments@berkeley.edu with this issue. (Hint: include your SID number in email.)
Thank you, I was able to enroll just now
Does CS61BL satisfy the prereq for CS169A instead of CS61B? I took CS61BL instead, but when I tried to enroll into CS169A, it said that I did not satisfy the prereq which is just CS61A and CS61B.
Confused what this means. Can I take cs 170 and 188 if 188 allows time conflicts?

The enrollment system will allow you to do so IF you enroll into CS 170 first. That said - it is YOUR responsibility to find out if instructors are willing to allow time conflicts...meaning, some classes like CS 170 do NOT offer alternate final exams. Just because the enrollment system doesn't prevent you from doing something doesn't mean the professors are okay with it.
What's the reason for no time conflicts for CS 170? I'm trying to take CS 186 or 189 with 170 next semester but all 3 classes are offered at the same time (Tu, Th 5-6:30 pm).

Likely, but it's too soon to know at this point. We are waiting to find out if classes will be in-person, remote, or both before we can know how far the teaching staff can stretch. I suspect we will be able to resolve class-expansion issues by mid June, right after we know the University policy is for F20.
would cs 170 and eecs 126 expand to accommodate everyone?

It is HIGHLY unlikely to expand. You can check the historical enrollments at: www.berkeleytime.com.

You can also read more info from the professor here: http://teaching.paulos.net/cs160_FL2020/faq.html
Is it likely that cs160 will be expanded? :/ Really hoping to take the class
Read the CLASS NOTES for each of those classes at classes.berkeley.edu. I've noted it there.
What about CS188 and CS 186, is time conflicts allowed?

Short version - CS 169 has now been reformatted & 'split' into two classes. CS 169A generally is fundamentals. CS 169L is the group project.  (I've REALLY paraphrased here - you should go read the class descriptions for each at guide.berkeley.edu)
What is the difference between CS169 and CS169A?

No - there are a couple of things happening at the same time for CS 61C right now.

You're on the wait list because we've had to set initial enrollments for nearly all lower div classes VERY low until we know what's happening for F20 teaching format. This has pushed many people who would normally just be enrolled onto the wait list. As soon as we know how far we can safely expand enrollments, we will do so - you can expect that to be the beginning of Phase 2. 

Separately - pre-reqs are being MANUALLY enforced this semester. This means that you can still enroll or wait list even if you haven't met the pre-reqs. The current plan is that during week 1 of class, I will pull a report to identify who has or has not met the pre-reqs and give it to the instructor who can then drop you for not meeting the stated pre-reqs for the class.
quick question, to satisfy programming experience from CS 9F, would it be okay to just send over projects I've done in Java? or if i have an internship this summer would that satisfy the same? thanks

The class notes for CS61C Fall 2020 say:

"Pre-reqs for this class WILL be enforced! [ COMPSCI 61A, along with either COMPSCI 61B or COMPSCI 61BL, or programming experience equivalent to that gained in COMPSCI 9C, COMPCI 9F, or COMPSCI 9G]"

I haven't taken CS61B yet, and just enrolled and was put on the waitlist. Does this mean that I needed to take CS61B before in order to officially enroll, or is this normal for undeclared students? 

Thank you.
Final exam groups are not finalized until early in the semester. I have no idea whether accommodations can be made or not at this time.

CS162 and CS169A have a final exam conflict at 3pm on Friday of finals week. Have final exam groups been finalized, and if they have been, are there any accommodations that would allow one to take both CS162 and CS169A in Fall 2020?

I rarely give definitive answers, especially now with so much COVID chaos.  BUT - we wouldn't have opened the class for enrollment if we didn't intend to offer it.

The issue is that the professor who was slated to teach the class, unfortunately, passed away in January so some things need to be shuffled between faculty and that takes time. We understand this class is vital to many students so we DO intend to offer it.
Is there a chance that CS70 would simply not be offered in fall 2020, due to not finding an instructor? Should students be worried about this possibility, and plan with it in mind?
No idea - in SP20 we found out the class was going to be offered about a week prior to classes starting!
When can we expect a decision about 182?
Good catch & I just updated the post. We opened it for enrollment without an instructor after I'd posted that & I forgot to update it.
In this post it says CS70 is closed. But it's not??
You should reach out to teaching staff with this question.
I have a direct class conflict with CS 61B during Fall 2020. Are alternate finals and midterms available? Thanks!

I do expect it to expand sometime in June - I'm just waiting for more clear guidance around what format the F20 classes will take so we know how far the teaching staff can stretch & whether we have to worry about physical distancing impact if we return to campus.
Understood. Thanks
Fall 20 CS188 has enrollment capacity at 500 right now, but most semesters it's 700-800. The class notes don't mention anything about expanding. Will CS188 not expand for fall?
What does it mean that CS170 prereqs would be "informally enforced"? I have taken 61B but not cs70. Would I be dropped? Thanks!

I'm currently in position 124/437 on the wait list for CS 170. I noticed on the post you said "Given the level of uncertainty at this time, I highly recommend that you use phase 1 units for classes that you really want and need, even if it means you will be on the wait list." Would it be wise to drop CS 170 and enroll in a backup class during phase 1.5, and then put in a swap request for CS 170 afterwards? Or is it possible that classes like CS 170 would only expand partially, where I may get in from position 124, but not position 437? Thanks in advance.

history.content:
(4/27/20 UPDATE:)

* CS 61C (and other lower div classes other than CS88) - For now, the plan is to restrict enrollment capacity to the room capacity until early phase 2 since we do not know what the teaching format for F20 will be yet. This is forcing many declared majors onto the wait list who would normally easily be enrolled into these classes. The message you receive may say that the reserve capacity is full for the class. Please continue to be patient while we wait for more information. We will expand the classes as soon as we are able to make informed decisions and communicate with everyone when we do.

* Given the level of uncertainty at this time, I highly recommend that you use phase 1 units for classes that you really want and need, even if it means you will be on the wait list. Unlike past semesters, you cannot use past experience to predict what will happen with potential class expansions for F20. Be aware that within the reserve capacity groups, the system will process enrollments based on the date/time you joined the wait list. In other words, the sooner you join the wait list, the better your chances of getting access to a seat in the class.

==========================

As in prior semesters, I am now posting the CS enrollment notes on classes.berkeley.edu in the CLASS NOTES section so that everyone can find them (even people who aren't on Piazza).

I seem to recall some kind soul in the past was able to compile the notes into a single Piazza post - if that can happen again, great but I am too swamped with SUMMER and FALL enrollments to do the work.

I WILL give y'all some hints to some changes in F20 for undergrad classes so you can go find more info on the class notes for yourselves.

CS 10 - will NOT use 999 sections in F20

CS 61C will informally enforce the pre-reqs for the class. Read the CLASS NOTES for more info

CS 70 - there's still no instructor assigned but we do intend to offer the class.

CS 88- will webcast but has extra credit for in-person lecture participation

CS 162 is an early drop deadline class

CS 169A will formally enforce pre-reqs - go read the CLASS NOTES on classes.berkeley.edu for more information.

CS 170 - NO time conflicts allowed even though webcasting. They will informally enforce pre-reqs for class. (again, see CLASS NOTES)

CS 176 - will informally enforce pre-reqs

CS 182/282 - I've heard this class may be offered in F20 but it's not currently on the schedule nor do I know if/when it will be added.

(This list is not complete - you can view the webcast list and CLASS NOTES for info regarding time conflicts)
history.subject: F20: CompSci Enrollment Notes for undergrad classes
